Join our next live hangout right here on this page. We'll demo products and answer any question you've got:
What is all this?
We're Peak Design, a San Francisco based product design company. We're also the luckiest goobers on the planet; we engineer and make world-class photography gear, and we both shape it and share it with the Kickstarter community.
We've got new stuff, and you can pre-order it by backing this Kickstarter project. Your new gear will ship worldwide before the end of this year!
This is Peak Design's 7th Kickstarter project! Holy Toledo, we can't even believe it ourselves. This time around, with your help, we are making our best products even better.
How to back this campaign:
1. Click "Back this project"
2. Pick your reward level
3. Want to add more stuff to your reward? Check out the Add-On Menu and increase your pledge amount accordingly
For detailed instructions, scroll down to the bottom of this page or see the FAQ.
Jump to: Add-On Menu | Reward Menu | FAQ
What are we making?
All-New Capture v3
It's a metal clip that lets you rigidly carry any camera on your backpack strap, belt, or bag. Take your camera more places, keeping it secure and instantly accessible. Our new design is made of beautiful machined and anodized aluminum, and is smaller, lighter, more durable, and more comfortable than ever before. There's a also new Pro Pad for heavy rigs or all-day carry.
All-New Slide + Slide Lite
They're the world's most quick-connecting, versatile, stable, and comfortable pro camera straps, one for DSLRs and one for mirrorless. All hardware and materials have been updated for better comfort, smoother operation, increase durability, and gorgeous aesthetics.
Why did we make 'em?
There are a million straps, harnesses, and holsters out there for carrying cameras, and none of them met our needs. They were bulky, flimsy, frumpy, floppy, and frustrating. We knew we could do better.
Why are we updating them now?
You (our Kickstarter backers) brought Capture, Slide, and Slide Lite to life several years ago, and those earlier versions are really, really great products. Since then, we've learned tons, and we knew we could make these core products even better. Our backers demand the best, and we feel inclined to give ya'll just that.
Peak Design has enormous plans for 2018. But before we start our next adventure, we had to give these three products the performance and aesthetic upgrades they deserve. Like momma used to say: dance with the one who brought ya. Now, let's meet these products:
 Capture: why is it so exceptionally dope?
Capture is, in our humble opinion, the best damn way to carry a camera. It keeps your camera rigidly secure, yet instantly accessible with the click of a button. 
   Jump to:  Add-On Menu  |  Reward Menu  |  FAQ
    Slide + Slide Lite: What makes 'em so freaking sweet?
Have you ever used a traditional camera strap? You're probably all too familiar with bouncing cameras, clunky connectors, annoying shoulder pads, tripod incompatibility, and frumpy looks. With Slide and Slide Lite you get none of that, and all of this:
    Jump to: Add-On Menu | Reward Menu | FAQ 
  Now for the nitty gritty.
Wow, you've really made your way down the page. Maybe that's because you're looking for more details. Well, lucky for you we didn't spare a single one.
Jump to: Add-On Menu | Reward Menu | FAQ  
And now for the big question...

Add-On Menu

Why such a short campaign?
There's a lot going on at Peak Design right now. We've launched over 20 SKUs in the last few months. It's almost holiday season. And, we'll soon be launching our own flagship retail store in San Francisco. We're keeping this campaign short and sweet so we provide top-notch service to our backers without dropping the other balls we have in the air. We also want to ship all rewards out before the end of the year! 
When will it all ship?
We expect all rewards to leave our warehouses by mid December. That means that many of you will receive awards before the end of the year and even before the holidays.
Please note that we cannot guarantee that rewards will ship by a certain date, and once rewards are in the mail, we have even less control over how long it takes them to reach your doorstep. We'll do everything in our power to get rewards out the door by early December, but we can't make any absolute promises. See the FAQ for details.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 7th Kickstarter project since 2011, so we've had ample time to hone our design, manufacturing, shipping, and supply chain management processes. Most importantly, we've gotten pretty darn good at setting our customers' expectations accurately and delivering on our promises.

But no matter how much we've got our poop in a group (official midwestern terminology) things can still go awry. If they do, we solemnly promise to give you full transparency into the issues and solve them in a way that leaves our backers happy and proud to support our company.

Supply Chain Risk: Sometimes a machine or tool breaks. Sometimes a factory loses power for a day. Sometimes we get the wrong parts or materials in. These things happen from time to time and can affect how long it takes to build our products.

Shipping Risk: It's the holiday season, the busiest shipping time of the year. Every year, record breaking volumes can cause port congestion, over-stuffed warehouses, and shipping service delays.

Acts of God: We're based in San Francisco. That means we could have an earthquake. Or we could have the Wellness Coach Convention and the Artisan Toast Convention scheduled for the same weekend (can you imagine finding a place to brunch, let alone park the Subaru?!). Whatever happens, we'll get through it together.

campaign.story:
Martenero's sixth watch release is the Kerrison. Our most versatile watch yet, equally at home in the office or out on the weekends. Its clean, balanced design comes alive through subtle details and uses of color. Everything is designed in-house, and we labored over every detail to get the balance just right. This is a watch that stands out just the right amount - a watch of subtle distinction you can wear for years on end.
And it's not just the design that makes it special. The Kerrison has an automatic movement that registers at 28,800 beats per hour, scratch-resistant sapphire crystals on the front and back, and a 42-hour power reserve. Serious specs that match the thoughtfulness of the design.
The Kerrison is available in 4 unique colorways, each in 2 different sizes (42 mm and 38 mm). 8 different versions available in total so that you can find the version that's perfect for you.
  Martenero combines a respect for the traditions of watchmaking with a unique vision that always looks forward. With a strong respect for the craft, we are driven to make our watches new classics in their own right. Original and contemporary, but always timeless.
   Martenero has been featured by:
   We're offering the Kerrison in four distinct colorways, all of which have different dial finishing. No matter what your aesthetic is, we have a version that's perfect for you.
WHITE & BLUE
This version has an enamel gloss finish throughout the dial, and the color contrast between the interior and the outer ring makes it easily stand out from the rest. A watch that people will notice.
White & Blue 42mm
  White & Blue - 38mm
  DARK BLUE
We opted for a pure matte finish on the dark blue dial. While the dial is a muted color, the bluish green indices and second hand give this model just the right amount of colorful detail.
Dark Blue - 42mm
  Dark Blue - 38mm
  WHITE & SILVER
The dressiest color colorway of them all. The silver outer ring with sunburst finishing gives this version a dressy touch that makes it perfect for any occasion.
White & Silver - 42mm
  White & Silver - 38mm
   BLACK & DARK BLUE
Look closely, and you'll see that the outer ring contrasts slightly not only in color with the black interior, but also in finishing. Matte interior with enamel gloss outer ring gives this watch a very unique look. The mint numerals and a red second hand give it additional pops of color.
Black & Dark Blue - 42mm
  Black & Dark Blue - 38mm
    While the design of the Kerrison is very clean, the construction behind it is surprisingly complex. The stainless steel case is custom designed and has complex brushed and polished finishing throughout, and the lugs are twisted and show off these different finishes.
The multi-layer dial has applied numerals and indices, and a variety of matte, gloss, and sunburst finishing. This is a very high level of detail that's normally associated with watches at a much higher price point, and it gives the Kerrison a very premium look.
      The Kerrison is powered by a Miyota 9015 movement that registers at 28,800 beats per hour. This is a very high quality Japanese movement used by premium watch brands, and it's similar in accuracy to much more expensive Swiss movements. It's an automatic movement, so it will wind itself naturally as you wear it. It's hacking, meaning that the second hand stops when you set the time, allowing for more accurate time setting. And with a power reserve of 42 hours, this is watch you can set aside for a while and it will continue to tick away. 
    Our leather straps are made of genuine leather in the US. Matching edge paint on the sides and a hypoallergenic leather lining give the straps a very refined and finished look. The stitching details on the sides show that each strap is made by hand.

Assembly and testing takes place in a Brooklyn workshop staffed by a family of watchmakers that has been in the business for two generations. campaign.story:
With its simple lines, clean dials and modern-classical looks, the Regatta is the result of 11 months of development and numerous re-designs.
Our inspiration came from the nautical world of yachts and sailboats. We designed the Regatta Chronograph models with the firm belief that style should never get in the way of function but should naturally derive from it.  
  Rossling & Co. has been crafting watches for over 5 years; with the Regatta Chronograph being our sixth collection. We have developed strong expertise in design, manufacturing and fulfillment and have solid relationships with experienced manufacturing partners. 
Every component of the Regatta is made from superior materials to ensure flawless operations for years to come. Our watches are designed to be an heirloom, to be passed down to the next generation. 
    Quality leather is not only durable and hard wearing but it develops a beautiful and unique patina as it ages. We use buttery soft Italian calf leather for both the outside and the lining. After you wear it for a few days, the strap will conform to the shape of your wrist for a custom fit.
5 models in the Regatta collection feature stainless steel mesh straps (also known as shark-proof straps). All versions are 100% waterproof and corrosion resistant. The adjustable clasps makes for a perfect fit.
The watch case is made of highly polished stainless steel (316L) for ultimate durability and strength. The caseback is made of the same material. Water resistance is rated at 50m/165ft/5ATM.
The Regatta Chronograph collection showcases 3 different dials (black, white and navy), all with a classic, crisp design. The dials feature applied hour markers and a square date window at 3 o’clock.
Chronographs have been used for centuries for maritime navigation. All Regatta models feature a quality quartz chronograph movement with a 4 min per year accuracy.
In addition to time and date, the watches feature 3 chronograph functions: elapsed time, accumulated elapsed time and split time, all with a 1 second accuracy.
The watches will be numbered and hand-assembled as a limited edition. Only 359 serialized watches will be made for each model. Each watch will be delivered with an international warranty card and a certificate of authenticity.
    PLAY

  Named after the Hamptons on the eastern tip of Long Island, world-famous summer playground for high society. The watches in this series are inspired by the sailing lifestyle. Light colored dials for the classical man. Subtle, recognized by those in the know, it exudes confidence and charisma.
    PLAY

  Inspired by the deep-water port of Astoria, founded by J. J. Astor, one of New York’s first business moguls 200 years ago. The Astoria series, with its black dials, is for the man of the world. It conveys an air of mystery and effortless charm that makes it irresistible.
       PLAY

  The Newport series is named after Rhode Island's famous port, venue for the America's Cup for over 50 years. It is home to many gilded era mansions famous the world over. The blue dials are reminiscent of the ocean. The Newport is for the man that does not fear being noticed. It has undeniable presence and a strong personality.
  We are delighted to introduce the Rossling & Co. Regatta Chronograph, our latest watch collection. Featuring classic good looks and superior craftsmanship. It will impress with its attention to detail.
        As a special thank you to our backers, we decided to add extra bonus gifts for all multiple watch rewards:
If you reserve 2 Regatta Chronograph watches, we’ll send you a complementary watch roll ($79 value). You will be able to securely - and stylishly - store and transport up to 6 watches from your collection.
If you reserve 3 Regatta Chronograph watches, we’ll send you a complementary watch roll ($79 value) PLUS we’ll also send you an extra watch strap of your choice (leather or mesh), a value of $39. All straps are interchangeable so you will be able to swap straps and change the style of your watches in seconds.
  You will love your new Rossling & Co. Regatta watch. We are very confident of that. If you happen to not be fully satisfied, whatever the reason, we will take your watch back and give you a full refund. This is our promise.
    Here's a small selection of the media coverage we received for our previous Rossling & Co. collections: 
“Nearly a year ago, Rossling & Co. made their name very known by way of a very successful Kickstarter campaign. […] a nice formula that mixed value and style.” - Worn & Wound 
“the watches are seriously awesome” - Cool Material 
“The Rosslings are attractive watches that could easily find their way into almost any collection.” - The Time Bum 
“At just over a year old, the Montreal based watch company has left a huge mark on the timepiece world, all-be-it with the aid of crowd-funding behemoth Kickstarter.” - Vouchmag 
“There is something very appealing about these watches that is hard to put your finger on. It’s in their simplicity and lack of pretension. They aren’t trying to be something they are not, they are just pleasant and easy to wear.” - Worn & Wound 
“While, Kickstarter campaigns often dilute true horology in search of profits, Rossling has committed itself to making high-quality watches for less.” - Ivy Time 
“Rossling & Co. definitely have made the case as one of the best up-and-coming watchmakers around.” – Vouchmag 
  Here's a small selection of the customer reviews we received: 
"I had to stop and remember to breath after I opened the box. The gold and blue with the domed sapphire was absolutely stunning." - Ken L., Modern 36mm - Westhill 
"Simple and elegant watch. It's timeless and goes with anything. I get compliments all the time from both women and men. It looks classic but bold, love it." - Thibault C., Classic 40mm - Glencoe 
"less is more (sometimes). It is definitely the case here! So thin so light, nothing left to say than; Buy this watch. Simplicity at its best" - Tobias P., Classic 40mm - Stirling 
"I am an avid watch collector and I can say that hands down this is my favorite watch. The simplistic design, paired with the unique band garners tons of compliments from family and friends. For the price, there is simply nothing that even comes close to comparing with this watch." - Alec A., Classic 40mm - Stirling
"One of my favourite watches to date. As a passionate collector I love coming across a fresh design. These guys have kept it simple and pulled off a really beautiful piece. The strap colour is so dynamic I end up wearing this more than the rest of my pieces combined. keep up the great work guys, looking forward to seeing what else you come up with." - Luke O., Classic Automatic – Westhill
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We realize that creating and delivering a product is a complex process and often comes with unexpected challenges. That is why we have been preparing. We gained tremendous experience through our 4 previous watch projects on Kickstarter since 2013.
We have spent the past several months making sure our supply chain is in check. We have well-established relationships with reliable watch manufacturers and strap makers. We have experience and we are prepared to deal with fulfillment of goods. We also have contingency plans for all the steps that are out of our control.
We are going to keep our backers informed during the production process. We'll do this with regular updates and sharing pictures as often as possible, for example when manufacturing of the watch cases is completed, during manufacturing of components, during final assembly, when the packaging is produced, etc…
If somewhere along the way we find that there is a setback in production, or that we cannot make the timeline, we will keep all of our backers informed.
In the end, we want to make Rossling & Co. a long-lasting brand of high-quality, stylish watches. We will do whatever it takes to fulfill our promises and to deliver watches that will exceed our backers’ expectations!

BALTIC is inspired by the raw beauty of the icy Baltic sea. Baltic watches are traditional with minimal, modern styling.
  BICOMPAX 001. Black & Silver (Photo by Lucas Laurent)
  HMS 001. Blue & Gold (Photo by Lucas Laurent)
     Check our watches on HODINKEE
       W&W Review
     BALTIC Podcast for W&W
  We are a family of watch connoisseurs with a passion for traditional craftsmanship. We believe the most timeless and desirable watches are often the simplest however, it seems many modern watch brands add unnecessary complexity to their designs. For this reason we decided to create BALTIC. We want to focus on a more authentic approach, bringing together the purest watchmaking techniques to create a vintage-inspired timepiece for your wrist.  
The results are neo-vintage, 1940’s-style watches with mechanical movements and well-proportioned cases inspired by the traditional Step Case watch (recognisable by its distinctive ridge or step surrounding the hesalite glass).  
   Wristshot - HMS 001. Cream
  Wristshot - BICOMPAX 001. Blue & Gilt
  Initially BALTIC will offer two different models: a 38mm manual-winding chronograph and a 38mm automatic three-hander. Both will be available with six different dial variations (you will be asked to choose the one you like at the end of the Kickstarter campaign).
    BICOMPAX 001. CREAM is a two register chronograph with a light cream colour dial. The indexes are painted in black, as is the railway. The chronograph central seconds hand is blued, while the other hands are black. The French words “BICOMPAX MANUEL” are printed in red across the bottom of the dial.
BICOMPAX 001. Cream

BICOMPAX 001. Black & Silver

L’idée est de s’approprier les caractéristiques d’époque, qui à notre sens, offrent le plus de cachet : un diamètre proportionné, un boitier aux lignes « brutes », un mouvement mécanique et l'utilisation d’un verre en acrylique.

campaign.story:
We are an independent brand with a design studio located in the creative heart of Paris.
We are pleased to introduce Shaper, our first collection of inspired watches for active men and women who travel, work and embrace life!
The NOWA watch is beautiful and connects to your smartphone for automatic time zones, activity, sleep tracking, and more. No charging is required.
NOWA redefines watchmaking standards and smartwatches with the slimmest intelligent watch ever made!
  “The Shaper by NOWA is a smartwatch that looks like a classic timepiece” Lulu Chang, Digital trends
“The NOWA Shaper is a more traditional hybrid smartwatch that takes a classic mechanical watch design and subtly sneaks in a few extra smarts” Chaim Gartenberg, The Verge
“Shaper is a great looking traditional watch with essential smartwatch features” Synthesis, Gracious Watch
“A skinny hybrid watch that keeps things simple” Sophie Charara, Wareable
  No matter where you go, NOWA conveniently adjusts to your time zones. The NOWA watch always displays the precise time for your location, anywhere in the world! It automatically syncs the watch hands to the time zone of your phone.
   PUT ON YOUR WATCH, PACK YOUR THINGS AND GO ANYWHERE!
Week 1: Destination Paris.
          The NOWA watch tracks and records your activity (steps, distance and calories burned) and sleep quality for a healthier lifestyle! Results are recorded and displayed in a simple, useful calendar for goal tracking. 
Your fitness data will be automatically recorded in your fitness secured cloud: Apple Health or Google Fit.
   The NOWA watch works up to 8 months on a single standard CR2025 battery and does things that other traditional vintage style watches can't do!
 NOWA Watch App is already on App store and Google Play.
           NOWA watch bands are made of genuine italien leather with nubuck lining (or striped nylon with calf leather lining). As a result, the watch sits on your wrist like a second skin. 
Each NOWA strap features quick-release pins for easy replacement! If you want to mix and match from the strap your NOWA Shaper comes with, buy an Additional Strap pledge and go wild!
  Finding his inspiration in the Contemporary Decorative Arts, Eric Gizard designed the Shaper collection with the desire for the perfect balance between beautiful and technical.
The simplicity of the watch face, the slim case for practical, comfortable daily wear and the understated yet refined look have made the NOWA watch a unique timepiece that is the very definition of excellence. 
                           Less is more. A classically designed watch reimagined for modern lifestyles. NOWA is fashionable beauty that fits any style.
People like us are already wearing the NOWA watch! 
    NOWA Shaper is more than just a timepiece, it is a work of art that pays respect to the traditions of watchmaking.
NOWA watches are crafted using only the finest materials and unwavering attention to detail: Swiss parts movement, Italian calf leather strap, durable stainless steel and Sapphire coated glass…
Simply the best minimalist watch under $150! 
The Shaper watch is a simple yet clever hybrid smartwatch that elegantly combines fashion and technology. 
  Minimalist world traveler watch
Designed by Eric Gizard and powered by Smartime
Genuine Italian Leather strap with Nubuck lining
Striped fabric strap with genuine leather lining
20mm width at lugs - Interchangeable strap
Fits any wrist from 165 mm to 215 mm circumference
Ronda Swiss Parts Quartz movement (2 hands)
40 mm diameter analog watch, 9.75 mm thickness
316L stainless steel case - silver finish - 3 ATM water resistance
Flat mineral glass with sapphire coating for better durability
GMT watch: Automatic time zone sync to phone
Activity tracker watch (steps, distance and calories burned)
Sleep quality monitoring
Camera control for selfies
Call notifications through the light indicator at 12 o'clock
Reject call at a push of the crown
Find your phone at a double push of the crown
Connects wirelessly to smartphone for Settings and Activity History
One week memory without having to sync to the NOWA Watch app 
Connect to Apple Health and Google Fit
Compatible with IOS8 / Android 4.3 and above versions
CR2025 - 8 months battery life under normal use. No charging required
CE, FCC and RoHS certified - smartwatch 2017
 Every NOWA is created without compromise and engraved with a unique identifying serial number.
We are proud to cooperate with Cypheme, a talented French startup that specializes in unfalsifiable authentification digital solutions. Using Cypheme authentification technology, you can now be assured that all watches from NOWA are genuine and authorized.
       Shaper watch works up to 8 months on a standard CR2025 watch battery. NOWA watch does not need to be charged. To replace the battery, take your NOWA to a qualified specialist.
  Spread the word and unlock new features and models! 
                                           Become a NOWA influencer and share your opinions right here during the campaign.
Buy any pledge and complete the short questionnaire for a chance to receive your watch delivered within one week and become a NOWA influencer. Offer limited to 8 people.
Find our influencers on Instagram and social with the hashtag: #WEARNOWA
    The Shaper collection is NOW ready and under intensive evaluation by reviewers, influencers, journalists and fans.
The most difficult processes are done : Product design, factory tooling, iOS & Android apps and packaging are all completed.  We just shipped the first 100 pieces pilot run to journalists, reviewers and influencers. 
    The NOWA Circle of Excellence is a free community of watch enthusiasts sharing their passion for perfection, travel and life.
Join us and share your life's journeys within the NOWA Circle using the hashtag #NOWAWATCH.
        Please check our FAQ at the top of the page.
If you can’t find your answer, email us HERE.

campaign.story:
Fast Co. Design | The Verge | Gessato | Hypebeast | Highsnobiety | Design Week | DesignTAXI | Designboom | Discovery Channel | Futurism
Introducing Hidden Time
In 2014 we released our first watch, the concentric disc Series 000, and were funded within 72 hours. In 2016, we launched the space-obsessed Series K452, and were funded within 24 hours.
Now, we’re back on Kickstarter to introduce our first international project, The Trio of Time, and release our third watch, Hidden Time.
Hidden Time in three editions
  Black watch + midnight straps
  Rose gold watch + coffee straps
   White watch + snow straps
  The Trio of Time 
The Trio of Time (TTT) is our very first experimental world tour to explore how international creativity reinterprets the perception of time. 
We will collaborate with a local designer in three different cities around the world to create a timepiece together, which will be released here on Kickstarter. 
Each watch will feature a unique design that represents the designer’s view on passing time. And with each watch we will share our experience with the Kickstarter community; in fact, backers of each campaign will be able to vote on our next destination.
Hidden Time is the first edition of TTT
The first TTT collaboration: Hong Kong to Seoul
Our TTT journey begins in Seoul, Korea.
Seoul is a prominent design city in Asia. With a rich history and rapid growth rate, the city features abundant resources for art and design. Many talented designers have launched studios in the city, contributing to both the local industry and the world at large.
We met with industrial designer Jiwoong Jung, an artist as fascinated by time as we are. Jung’s product design work has been featured in the 2012 and 2014 Maison & Objet Paris exhibition, among others, and in international design publications.
Beautiful architecture in Seoul
  A few of Jiwoong Jung's beautiful products
Together, we are releasing Hidden Time
Early designs of Hidden Time
  The watch's beautiful gradient makes time disappear as it passes by
  Jiwoong Jung working on our first collaboration
  The rose gold edition offers a slight variation on gradient colors
Hidden Time, the vanishing timepiece
Hidden Time's watch face features a beautiful gradient display under a crystal covering where numbers are firmly printed. As hours pass, the hour gradient disc rotates and “hidden time” is revealed.
The watch helps you focus on time in the moment, using a modern interpretation of the camouflage effect to hide the passing hours.
“My research on how to naturally pass time began with how hiding occurs in nature, which led me to one of the best known examples––the chameleon’s protective color. Their defense mechanism is a kind of optical illusion, but a simple and effective way to have two things together naturally when superimposed.” ––Jiwoong Jung
Hidden Time in black
  A beautiful light violet gradient compliments the rose gold edition
  Time disappearing as hours pass by
  A striking balance between lines and gradients
  Coffee straps feature a matching rose gold buckle
  The powerful watch is thin and lightweight
Watch time pass in a new way 
  How to read Hidden Time
Features
Typeface
Crystal printed watch face over rotating gradient graphic. 
Includes a unique type, Favorit, in collaboration with Dinamo Typefaces (Johannes Breyer and Fabian Harb).
Favorit typeface from Dinamo Typefaces
   For everyone
The 39mm case is designed for both men and women. 
316L stainless-steel enclosed casing.
Available in black, rose gold, or silver.
Ultra thin - only 8.7mm (0.34in).
Hidden Time is the perfect size for any wrist
  The timepiece stands out while complimenting your look
   Docking system
Interchangeable strap system that secures straps with a simple pull and click within seconds.
Straps available in white, coffee, or midnight (you will choose this during the survey process).
Anicorn's smart docking system allows for easy strap swaps
      Straps can be interchanged to fit your current outfit or mood
Swiss accuracy
Driven by a Swiss Ronda Caliber 515 Quartz Movement, a high grade and reliable jeweled model that allows for smooth spinning with great accuracy.
The Swiss Ronda 515 is known as one of the highest quality quartz movement motors, with slim dimensions and long preserved running time.
The jeweled model allows for seamless spinning
  Packaging
We know how important delivery is, which is why we’ve created a beautiful new package for this edition of The Trio of Time. Each timepiece comes ready to be assembled with easy smart straps. Just wind the watch to your time zone, and experience the beauty of Hidden Time.
Every item pledged for on Kickstarter is subject to a final quality check at our Hong Kong studio, before being hand packaged with care in our premium packaging.
Anicorn packaging for the first TTT edition
  The timepiece comes ready to be assembled and worn
  We will perform a final quality check at our Hong Kong studio
          Specifications
Movement: Swiss Ronda Caliber 515 Quartz movement.
Battery life: Around 45 months. There is a power saving mechanism with pulled out stem: Reduction of consumption approximately 70%.
Housing: 316L Stainless steel, Ø 39mm (1.54 in), height 8.7mm (0.34in), back & screws, PVD plating.
Glass: Sapphire glass - Scratch Resistant

Water resistance: 50 meters / 5ATM (164 ft).
Strap: Genuine leather (18mm lug width) + stainless steel buckle with smart docking system. One size fits all.
What’s next?
TTT is a continuous global journey. If successful, we hope all our backers will join us in exploring our next destination (New York? Vienna? São Paulo?) to expand our perceptions of time.
We want to make our backers a part of the process––that’s why after our successful campaign, we’ll let you vote on our next destination!
Anicorn's collection of timepieces
Why Kickstarter?
We're so excited to return to Kickstarter for our latest project, and we're so thankful to have such a strong community around the work we do. Thanks to our past two campaigns, we were able to bring our timepieces to life and establish our business. 
We wanted to present our project to our loyal backers first, since they've been such an important part of our journey. We can't wait to take this new step together. 
Join us in bringing this collaboration and subsequent journeys to life––we can't do it without you!
                 Thank you!
This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.

campaign.story:
Most succinctly described as Legend of Zelda meets Harry Potter, Mages of Mystralia is a single-player action-adventure set in a lively fantasy world in which you can design your own spells.
In this homage to the fantasy genre's most iconic archetype, the mage, you will need to master the art of spellcrafting. Through solving environmental puzzles and defeating formidable enemies, you will come to explore the millions of possible spell combinations on your path to becoming a real mage! 
The story is being written by bestselling author Ed Greenwood, creator of the Forgotten Realms fantasy world for Dungeons and Dragons, which served as the basis for games like Baldur’s Gate and Neverwinter Nights, as well as about 170 other fantasy books. 
This epic adventure has an immersive soundtrack that was recorded live by the Video Game Orchestra and orchestrated by Shota Nakama (Final Fantasy XV, Kingdom Hearts II.5 HD Remaster).
Feel free to listen to a mash-up of our original OST while reading!
Mages of Mystralia was created around a new and innovative spellcrafting system that allows you to create millions of new ways to fight enemies and solve environmental puzzles!
To accomplish this, you are given a spell book with four basic spell types:
You can modify these spells by adding and combining different runes to them.
Behavioral runes: Adds a specific behavior that stacks with other behaviors attached to the spell.
Augment runes: Modifies the runes to which they are connected, changing the variables of the behavior.
Trigger runes: Nests additional spells within the current spell when certain trigger conditions are met.
As the game progresses, your spell book's contents will grow, opening up an exponentially growing number of options. You can then mix and match runes in order to create mega-spells that are greater than the sum of their parts. For example:
If we start with an Actus Orb of Fire...
 By adding the 'Move' behavior rune, we get a fireball.
 And adding a 'Duplicate' behavior rune gives us a triple fireball.
Now if we attach the 'Duplicate' behavior rune to an Ice Ego spell instead, it gives an ice sculpture that can be used as a decoy to escape enemies.
Then, we can add the 'Periodic' trigger rune to our ice sculpture to nest another spell. When prompted, we select the triple fireball. This creates an ice turret!
Finally, attaching the 'Right' augment rune on the turret will make it turn clockwise, shooting in 360 degrees.
You can also use 'Rain', 'Impact', 'Teleport' and many more amazing runes to create even crazier spells!
Four spell types, four elements and eighteen runes can be placed on the spellcrafting grid in order to create tons of incredible combinations! Whenever we put the spellcrafting system in front of new players, someone invariably comes up with a new spell we've never seen before!
So you're not constrained by what we, the game's creators, put in the game for you to discover. Instead, you are limited only by your own creativity and imagination.
At PAX East, PAX West, PAX South, PAX East again, SXSW and the PlayStation Experience, the reaction to our spell system has been incredible! But don't take our word for it, here is what the media had to say:
Learn more about our unique spellcrafting system!
Want to learn more about Mages of Mystralia's unique approach to spellcrafting? We've got you covered! The following video combines parts 1-3 of our spellcrafting tutorial, narrated by none other than Dan Adelman himself.

Keep in mind that this video only gives you a (very) small insight of all the possibilities offered! What spells will YOU create?
Mages of Mystralia has responsive action-adventure controls that have been perfected to feel intuitive and fun.
But be careful... The world of Mystralia is a dangerous place. Monsters roam freely in the wilds and you never know what enormous creatures lurk in the shadowy corners of the realm... 
This polished gameplay, combined with the moving soundtrack and beautifully rendered cel shaded graphics really allowed the team to bring this immersive game to a level of quality that they are extremely proud of.
In Mages of Mystralia, you play as Zia, a young woman who discovers that she has been born with an innate sense of magic. Unfortunately, arcane powers have been banned from the kingdom, forcing her to go into exile and learn the ways of magic as she looks to gain some control over her powers and stumbles into a story of epic proportions!
On her journey, she meets other exiled mages and discovers runes with magical properties, realizing that she can combine these in different ways to come up with millions of new spells!
When Ed Greenwood set to the task of writing the story of Zia’s adventure, he couldn’t help but flesh out the entire world and its lore. The history of the kingdom of Mystralia was an interesting enough story in its own right, so we worked with acclaimed webcomic creators Brian Clevinger and Carey Pietsch to tell that story in comic book form.
The more you know your Mystralia history, the better you’ll be able to identify the subtle references to these events of the past and how they’ve come to shape Zia’s present.
A wide range of different environments are spread out across the vast world of Mystralia, where villagers, merchants and mages live. You will explore the many different areas of the game in order to find epic treasure, solve mind-bending puzzles and experiment with spells in order to become a true mage!
Mages of Mystralia’s original orchestral score was performed by the Video Game Orchestra and orchestrated by Shota Nakama, one of the masterminds behind the scores of Final Fantasy XV and Kingdom Hearts II.5 HD Remaster.
Furthermore, the music in the game is dynamic, meaning that depending on the setting and the actions a player makes, the music will adapt itself, adding instruments, accelerating or slowing the pace and basically modulating to fit every in-game situation!
 Some of the projects our team members have worked on previously :
Borealys Games is made up of experienced developers who’ve spent years working in the AAA industry, which really allowed the team to add that extra layer of polish to the gameplay and visual elements of the game.
The game is already a lot of fun and the players' response at events has been heartwarming, but we still have some polish (improved animations, particle effects, and enhanced sound effects - among others) that we think will really take the game to the next level. In addition, we also have a few features up our sleeves as stretch goals that we would love to obtain.
More importantly, we want to get feedback on the game from our most ardent supporters, who will get the beta immediately after the campaign is processed!
Although the team has had years of experience in the industry, Mages of Mystralia is the studio's first public appearance and we are coming to Kickstarter to find and grow our core player community.
We want fans of magical action-adventure games to join us as we look towards the game's official launch in Q2 of 2017!
Recently there have been several Kickstarter campaigns that have raised an amount of funding to prove that the concept is viable, but then seek publisher or outside investor support for what they really need. We are taking the opposite approach. We built our proof-of-concept, got investment, and made our game. It is fully playable beginning to end, and many would consider it complete.
But as we’ve observed our playtesters and gotten feedback, we’ve generated a ton of ideas that would not take too long to implement but have the power to take this game to the next level. Adding all of those little tweaks and extra polish will only add a couple months to our schedule, so for a relatively modest sum, we can have a huge impact.
Of course, we already have plans for how we’d like to expand the game post launch with new game modes. If we exceed our goal, we’ll be able to staff up more aggressively and deliver those new features sooner than if we had to wait for the game to launch.

campaign.story:
Thank you very much for supporting our Kickstarter! If you found out about Lost Ember too late and still want to support us, you can still do that at our homepage at lostember.com/shop!
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Deutsche Version (German translation)
Version française (French translation)
Version en español (Spanish translation)
Versão Português (Portugese translation)
русский версия (Russian translation)
日本語版 (Japanese translation)
中文版 (Chinese translation)
You can also support us via PayPal!
Up until now we financed the development of Lost Ember with contract works and side jobs. Now we finally want to show you what we have accomplished so far and ask for your support so we can start to work on our dream project full-time! 
With Kickstarter we hope to raise the funds necessary to finish the development of our game while still staying independent and keeping our creative freedom.
If you don't know what Kickstarter is: you can buy the different editions of the game and if we reach our goal, the game will be developed and you will receive everything you ordered at the release of the game!

You can find out more about it here.
In Lost Ember you uncover the secrets of a fallen civilization as a wolf that has to find his place in the world. With the ability to control every animal you see, you have everything you need to find your way to Machu Kila - the city that shall answer all the questions that your mysterious companion raises.
GAMEPLAY
The gameplay in Lost Ember focuses on experiencing the world and the story from fascinating perspectives. Each animal you can play offers new possibilities and opportunities for breathtaking moments. Dive into deep waters, fly at lofty heights, dig underground as a mole or even climb steep cliffs with a mountain goat. We want players to move through our world in their own pace without interrupting their gameflow with combat, too hard puzzles or dying in general.
THE COMPANION / STORY
On your journey you are guided by a companion that used to be part of the old Inrahsi culture and witnessed the fall of his world. As the last soul of the old civilization he wandered the world for an eternity, searching for someone who could help him on his quest. 
His ability to show you his memories - echoes of the past - lets you relive what he's been through. These memories can be unveiled at different places throughout the world.
During the game, the wolf and his companion form a deep relationship of friendship and trust. 
SWITCH PERSPECTIVES / GAMEPLAY  
While the main character is the wolf, players can possess any other animal they encounter in our world which gives them great mobility. Some of the animals featured in Lost Ember are parrots, fish, moles, eagles, capybaras, mountain goats, buffalos and more. Additional animals are planned as part of some of our stretch goals.
These animals inhabit different areas in our world and while some occur in various scenarios, others may only populate a specific region. On their way to Machu Kila, the wolf and his companion cross through a lot of distinct areas with their own flora and fauna.
Lost Ember will be available for XBox One, PC and Playstation 4. If you buy the game here at kickstarter, you will be able to choose your preferred platform at release. 
We plan to bring the PC version to Steam and GOG.com. Vote for us in our Greenlight campaign to get Lost Ember to Steam!
Powered by Unreal Engine 4
Yes, Lost Ember will be playable in VR! We already tested it with HTC Vive and Oculus Rift and let me tell you: it's awesome! We don't consider Lost Ember a "VR game", however, and still concentrate on the game itself and not the VR part. But if you have a VR headset at home, you will be able to switch on the VR mode at any given time and dive even deeper into our world. Whether we'll be able to bring Lost Ember to Playstation VR is still unsure.
Craig Connor (former Music Director at Rockstar North) and Will Morton (former Senior Audio Designer and Dialogue Supervisor at Rockstar North) from Solid Audioworks produce all music and sound for Lost Ember! With a combined experience of over 30 years in the games industry working on games like GTA I-V, Red Dead Redemption, L.A. Noire and more, they bring a ton of expertise and talent to the team. You can find out more about them at their homepage www.solidaudioworks.com.
We founded Mooneye Studios about 2 years ago after meeting in a game development masters program in university. We all worked in the games and media industry for several years and together as a team on some smaller projects. Soon we realized that we work extremely well together and since none of us wanted to work in a big company with huge hierarchies and no real creative freedom anymore, we took an a bit risky step and quit our jobs to start our own indie studio.
And that's us! :) From left to right we are:
Pascal Müller - Programming - @RichAndBit
Tobias Graff - Programming - @tobiasgrf
Florens Huhn - Narrative Designer - @FlorensWho
Matthias Oberprieler- 3D Artist - @MOberprieler
Maximilian Jasionowski- Art Direction - @M_Jasionowski
To make supporting our campaign as rewarding to you as possible, we thought of a bunch of really cool stuff that you can get in our reward tiers! The individual items are illustrated below:
Well, this one is pretty self-explanatory: you will get the game as soon as it's released for either PC, XBox One or PS4.
You will be mentioned in Lost Ember's credits!
Includes the digital copy of the game and your name in our credits
The soundtrack for Lost Ember featuring music and sound by Craig Conner, Music Director for the entire GTA series and more, and Will Morton, former Dialogue Supervisor & Senior Sound Designer at Rockstar North.
Choose between 3 extra skins for your main character. Extra skins are only available during the kickstarter! After that, there won't be any option to change skins in the game.
You will get the PDF version of our artbook with a lot of concept art from the very early days up until the final product. We will explain some of our design decisions and try to give you an in-depth look behind the scenes of the development.
We will design a high-resolution wallpaper exclusively available to kickstarter backers!
A digital map of the game world with an overview over all the different areas from the wide grasslands to the decayed city of Machu Kila.
Includes Digital Game Edition with everything above
Get our printed hardcover artbook to browse through the pages and always have it at hand in your bookshelf.
Includes Digital Plus Edition and the physical artbook
Looking for that extravagant touch? Get our soundtrack on a 12″ Vinyl-LP! You will also have the option to choose a CD version of the soundtrack, if you don't have a way of playing a vinyl LP.
You will get access to the closed beta version of Lost Ember and help us to improve the game!
Revisit the places you found in-game and follow your path to Machu Kila on a poster of our game world! 
Your chance to actually be in the game! Find your name on a memorial plate for fallen heroes, that is discoverable by all players and even holds a memory to uncover.
A few very rare legendary animals inhabit our world. While all players can find and possess some of these legendary animals, you will be able to find 3 additional animals that are kickstarter-exclusive!
6 additional deluxe wolf skins that are only available on kickstarter and let your wolf shine in a new light!
Includes Physical Artbook Edition with everything above
The Limited Boxed Edition of Lost Ember contains a key for the digital download of the game in an kickstarter-exclusive case with the soundtrack on CD, as well 3 postcards printed on high quality paper.
A handmade statue of Lost Ember's main character, crafted by the incredibly talented Isabel from www.allerleiunfug.de! This statue will be cast in resin, very high quality and roughly 18cm (7 inches) high.
  A DIN A2 (that's 420 x 594 mm or 16.5 x 23.4 inches) poster of this amazing artwork.
Additionally to the regular poster, you will get one that is signed by the whole team!
Be one of the firsts to get your hands on Lost Ember with our alpha access key! Make Lost Ember an even better game by giving us your feedback and ideas.
Includes Explorer Edition with everything above
You will get 2 tickets to Lost Ember's release party at the release of the game! We will celebrate with an amazing party in our hometown Hamburg in Germany. 
Your travel costs are not included in this package.
The old Inrahsi emperors were buried in the tombs of Machu Kila. Massive statues still remind their descendants of their grandiosity. You can become one of them! You will be immortalized as one of the statues that we will design with you after your image. The tomb will be discoverable by all players and even be a part of our story.
You will get a premium mention in our credits to let the world know that you were a huge help in finishing our game!
Includes Physical Gold Edition with everything above
And, because it's not long until Christmas, we thought of a little something to give to all our backers! We will send all of you a PDF with 11 different cards to print at home! So if you think about getting Lost Ember or some of the rewards as a present for your loved ones, you now have the perfect card for it :)
We've planned much more for Lost Ember than we have shown you here! In case we exceed our goal of ~$110,000 (100.000€) we can include even more awesome features. These are the first stretch goals we have planned:
       Aside from our regular stretch goals, we planned a few social stretch goals through which you can decide which animals will be added to the game on top of the current 9! Participate at www.lostember.com/animals!
                     Kickstarter helps us secure funding for the development of Lost Ember while retaining full creative control. "Creative control", you ask? That means we can continue developing freely and independently without interference from the outside. 
Now I'm gonna be honest here: with our target goal of $110,000 (100,000€) we still would need some additional funding from publishers or alike. However, the money would get us to a first, full alpha version of the game. It is the minimal budget that brings us to a point where we feel comfortable enough to talk to publishers about deadlines and all the features that we want in our game. 
We're certain to be able to get that last chunk of money to finish Lost Ember, as we are already talking to several publishers who all are extremely interested in our game. So Lost Ember will be finished with just $110,000 (100,000€) from Kickstarter. But to get to a point where we could finish the game with full creative freedom we would need about $390,000 (350.000€). With that we could truly make Lost Ember everything we want it to be. 
Now maybe some of you ask themselves, for what we need that much money. Well, one big reason is that we not only have to pay us and our office space, but also taxes, payment providers, and Kickstarter, who take 5% of the raised money. We made this little pie chart to visualize this for you.
Because we are a small independent team without a huge marketing budget, we thought of a little something special to spread the word about Lost Ember and our kickstarter campaign: During our campaign we will visit different youtubers, press and other indie developers in a camper van we got from Tobias' mother and uncle and play a pre-alpha demo of Lost Ember with them! 
We want to show you how the current game looks and feels to give you a better idea of where it is heading. To make that a little more fun for you, we will make videos of the whole thing and upload them as often as we can to our youtube channel at https://www.youtube.com/c/mooneyestudios.
So make sure to support the campaign to get notifications whenever we release a new video! :) You will be able to follow us and check out where we are constantly on a GPS map at our website at lostember.com/tour and, if we are anywhere near you, feel free to drop us a line and if possible, maybe we can arrange a meet-up and show you our demo in person!
SPECIAL THANKS
We thank Jacob Pavek for prividing the Song "Illume" for our Kickstarter Video. Link to his Soundcloud Page: https://soundcloud.com/jacob-pavek

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we mentioned a few paragraphs above, we still would need money from publishers or partners like the IndieFund, if we get less than ~$390,000 (350.000€). And of course there is always the possibility that we don't get that. But with as many interested parties as we are already talking to at the moment and a successful kickstarter campaign in our bags, the likelihood of this is pretty low. And even if it happens, we can always go back to doing contract works or side-jobs as we do at the moment. That would of course increase the development time, especially if we get significantly less than $390,000 (350.000€), but we can definitely promise you that we'll do our best so that Lost Ember will see the light of day as soon and as magnificently as possible!

Another risk of the development is the release date, of course. We hope to be able to bring Lost Ember to you in early 2018, but there are always unforeseen factors that can delay the release of a game.

campaign.story:
We love handheld consoles. Now that smartphones and tablets are overtaking handhelds we need good games to play, real games for gamers, on a dedicated gaming platform more than ever. 
We have chosen AMD’s powerful embedded low-powered SoC with its blazing fast performance and power efficiency on portable devices. Thanks to their latest technological advances, the dream of playing your PC games on the go is becoming a reality.
  With more than 10,000 games out of the box, and you don't need to purchase them again. Just load and play any game from your Steam™ Library.
More than 5 hours of battery life.
Powerful enough to play almost any game on Steam: Portal 2, DOTA, Left 4 Dead 2, Team Fortress 2, SOMA, Civilization V, Metro: Last Light Redux, Borderlands 2, The Witcher 2, etc.
Haptic touchpad controls: The evolution of the mouse! And if you are a more old-school gamer, you can configure your own control scheme using the Z-Pads!
All your favorite games: AAA, indies, strategy, RTS, action, FPS, adventure, MMO, mods, etc. The Steam™ catalog is bigger and better than ever and great new games are arriving every day. 
 Check here for the list of Steam™ games currently supported on Linux: https://steamdb.info/linux
Or the Windows compatible Steam™ games list here: http://store.steampowered.com/search/?tags=-1&category1=998&os=win
You can also play games outside of Steam™. SMACH Z is a handheld PC and you can install any game or program that you want. You can also play web games, MMOs, emulators or anything else that you can do on your PC.
  CPU: AMD Merlin Falcon RX-421BD (12-15w) SoC at 2.1 GHz 
Cores: 4/4 
iGPU: Radeon R7 at 800 MHz 
RAM: 4GB (SMACH Z) || 8GB (SMACH Z PRO) DDR4 2133 MHz 
HD: 64GB (SMACH Z) || 128GB (SMACH Z PRO) 
Screen: 6” FULL HD (1920x1080). Capacitive touch-screen.
Battery: 5 hours of gaming. 
MicroSD Card Slot. 
USB 3.0 type C. 
HDMI video output connection. 
Wi-Fi connectivity 5.0 Ghz. 4G LTE mobile network connectivity (PRO model only) 
Bluetooth connectivity. 
Front-camera 3-megapixels (PRO model only)
*Some specifications depend on Stretch goals, you can check Stretch goals at the end of the page. 
These are the technical specifications of the AMD SoC model that will be used in SMACH Z:
  Explore the SMACH Z's epic final look on this 3D simulation.
   When pre-ordering SMACH Z you can choose between Windows 10 or Linux.
Windows 10:  With Windows you have more compatible games and programs. However we won't be able to adapt the OS to our console, so it may not be as easy to use as the Linux based system.
Linux (SMACH Z OS): We're able to modify and adapt the OS to SMACH Z creating a better interface and experience. We recommend choosing Linux for better performance. More and more games are becoming compatible with Linux with time; now there are about 2,500. 
  The button layout will use two haptic touch pads, a joystick (clickable), 4 action face buttons, 4 trigger buttons and 2 additional action buttons in the rear-back.
Anyone will be able to create their own custom control schemes. The touch pads are also buttons with different areas of detection, so they can be used in many ways.
If you are a "classic" gamer, and you prefer more traditional controls... you can use the Z-Pads add-ons. They are adapters to configure the SMACH Z controls by attaching them to either touchpad.
This simple yet magic solution will permit you to play with a real D-Pad on your SMACH Z, add a second stick or add more buttons. There are plenty of combinations!
* Z-Pads are sold separately.
More powerful, more storage, front-camera and 4G connection. Recommended if you are going to play demanding games, for youtubers or for MMO players that need to always play online.
Versions specs comparison:
SZ PRO: 8GB RAM vs SZ: 4GB RAM. 
SZ PRO: 128GB HD vs SZ: 64 GB HD. 
SZ PRO: Front-camera vs SZ: No camera. 
SZ PRO: 4G connectivity vs SZ: Only WIFI.
  The following benchmarks have been run on the final hardware of the SMACH Z PRO: Merlin Falcon RX-421BD (12-15w) SoC at 2.1 GHz with Radeon R7 at 800 MHz and 8 RAM, running on Windows 10.
Metro: Last Light Redux (720p. High settings) ~ 35 FPS
Company of Heroes 2 (720p. Medium settings) ~ 25 FPS
Jotun (1080p) ~ 45 FPS
Skyrim (720p. High setting) ~ 25 FPS
Just Cause 2 (720p. Medium settings) ~ 35 FPS
Spiral Knights (1080p) ~ 50 FPS
Overwatch (720p. Medium) ~ 30 FPS
Torchlight II (1080p. Very high settings) ~ 35 FPS
Xcom: Enemy Unknown (720p. High settings) ~30 FPS
Civilization 5 (1080p. High settings) ~ 28 FPS
Tomb Raider: Survival Edition (720p. Medium settings) ~ 40 FPS
Alien: Isolation (720p. Ultra settings) ~ 35 FPS
  We hope this gives you an idea of the kind of games and power that you can expect from SMACH Z. We will continue testing with more games and publish new videos on updates. Please don't hesitate to ask for your favorite games.
* Remember that these benchmarks are being run on the AMD development board with the final hardware, and not directly on the current cased prototype, which have weaker hardware. Check the prototypes section for more information.
      SMACH Z is a handheld PC with plenty of other possibilities. Some examples: 
Streaming. SMACH Z has been designed to be an stand-alone handheld, but If you are using SZ in your house, you can also stream games from your PC or Playstation 4 via WIFI. This allows you to play games that aren't supported by Steam OS or use the power of your PC to play more demanding games. Just lay down on your couch or bed, with your PC with Steam open, and load any game you want directly from your SMACH Z.

Play on the TV via HDMI. You can connect SMACH Z to a TV and use it as a home console, that you can bring everywhere. You can even connect another gamepad and play multiplayer! 

Emulators. SMACH Z will be the best handheld device for emulation, and Retro Z-Pads will bring your fingers back to the past. NES, SuperNintendo, Megadrive, Playstation 1 and 2, Nintendo64, GameCube or even Wii games will be in your hands. 

Multimedia Center. We plan to integrate KODI, an open source software for playing videos, music, podcasts, and other digital media files. 

Browse internet and use programs. SMACH Z is a portable PC, so you can install anything on it.

Portable PC. Connect a keyboard and mouse and plug it to a monitor and you will have a PC that you can bring with you easily.

Gamepad: Use SMACH Z as a gamepad controller for your PC too.
 
Twitch and Skype: With the SMACH Z PRO you can make videos of yourself playing games from the beach or do Skype calls.

Open Platform: We want to keep SMACH Z an open console. If you prefer to install another OS, you are free to do whatever you want with it. We will give the community all the info and code needed to support another OS or develop additional features. 

Attachable extra battery: Add a second battery in the back of SMACH Z for +5 hours of additional gameplay outdoors. 

Accelerometer & Gyroscope: A cool way to control racing or airship games.

4K Video: SMACH Z SoC has hardware-accelerated High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC) decode of 4K video playback.
  The prototype will not be the final form of the console. We're updating the look and form of SMACH Z to make it more comfortable to handle with the new 6" screen size. The main modifications include:
Made more prominent grips, to make it more comfortable 
Reduced the touchpads from 40mm to 35mm. 
Moved the option buttons to the top, to access easier 
Adjusted positions of buttons and other aesthetic changes. 
The final version will also be much thinner and compact with an estimated weight of approximately 400 grams. 
      SMACH Z Deep Black is the basic edition. But you can also get it in other different colors: Pearl White, Red Fire, Radioactive Green and Indigo. Plus, another 2 new color editions will be decided by the backers in the development forums.
You can choose any color combination when you pre-order your SMACH Z in Kickstarter without additional cost. Also, if you change your mind, you can decide the color later.
  Clickarm is a modular hardware and firmware platform for the development and manufacturing of devices. It offers scalability and enormous economic savings both in research and in product deve­lopment and manufacturing. The Clickarm modular platform is inspired by the spirit of the Com­patible PC and by the Wintel platform. 
PLAY



Until today there was no standardized alternative equivalent in the world of mobile devices based on high integration embedded solutions (mobiles, tablets and other mobile devices). Clickarm means the perfect interaction between hard­ware and software (firmware). 
With Clickarm the performance of your SMACH Z can be improved even after its purchase. You will be able to purchase more modules of RAM, storage or even a new SoC and install it easily yourself or send it to us.
  SMACH Z will have passive cooling only, using the latest Copper Foam technology in heat sinks. Testing shows that these heat sinks can outperform their comparable competitors by up to 6ºC/W, making this new range a major breakthrough in thermal management.
The large surface area created by the interconnected pores of the foam coupled with the excellent thermal conductivity of copper allows either for the height of the heat sinks to be reduced or improved thermal performance in the same form factor.
The copper foam is coated with a thin, hard layer of high temperature copper oxide that improves the emissivity of the foam to improve its radiant properties and reduce the temperature of the components.
  By participating in this Kickstarter you will help a PC handheld console become real, but it's also a good opportunity to get your SMACH Z earlier than everyone and at much lower price. Check the rewards at the right column.
  The goal of 250.000 is the minimum to make SMACH Z real, but to make it more awesome we need all of your support.
    Know someone who would be as hyped as you are about SMACH Z? Share our campaign with them. We also have cool rewards for all the backers when we reach social goals:
1,000 shares: Exclusive SMACH Z wallpaper 
5,000 shares: Digital SMACH Z Christmas card.
10,000 shares: Exclusive SMACH Z sticker for all the backers. 
                                                   SMACH Z will open a new window for game developers to distribute their games. Even if all PC games will be compatible, we're willing to work with developers to help to adapt the games to SMACH Z.
Additionally, we'd also love to have games designed specifically for our platform too. Every SMACH Z is a dev kit, and you don't need to purchase a license or SDK. But if you are a developer willing to develop for SMACH Z, take a look to the Developer's Perk: It grants access to full development support, in the technical side as well as on the marketing for gaining visibility on our platform.
We really hope SMACH Z will bring more opportunities for Indies, to innovate and experiment with new ideas.
"That thing looks great! I hope it works out!" - Terry Cavanagh - VVVVVV developer
"SMACH Z looks interesting and you seem to have found a space in the gaming world to fill." - Vishnu Vijayakumar - Tale Worlds - Mount&Blade developer
"The concept sounds fantastic!" - Andy Schatz - Pocketwatch Games - Monaco developer.
"Smach Z's portability and power really bring something to the table that other Steam Machines don't. Can't wait to have one of these in my hands". - Enrique Corts - Super Mega Team - Rise&Shine developer.
"This looks awesome!" - Alex Nichiporchik - TinyBuild Games - Party Hard developer.
  Case Prototype: The current cased prototype is fully functional and has a similar look, but it's not the final form factor and it doesn't have the final hardware:
It uses a Bay Trail SoC with 2GB RAM.
It's bulkier and heavier than the final form.
All controls and functionality works.
It runs Windows. 
It's using clickARM.
It's capable to run old 3D games such as Left4Dead 2 and Half-Life 2 at 15 FPS natively. 
During the Gamescom the cased prototype was not 100% complete and had problems with power. Because of that it only ran some small games.
Here you can see some images of the "making off":
        And here finally working:
AMD Merlin Falcon development board: This is a different prototype that demonstrates the power of the final hardware. It's not cased, it's a board with the final SoC configured with the same settings, and RAM as the final console will have.
Note: When testing framerate and performance we're using the AMD board. If in the videos show the cased prototype, it is because we're streaming from the AMD board. 
Since the first announcement of the project a year and a half ago, we've been listening to all your suggestion to improve SMACH Z:
6" Screen. We run a poll and the results where very clear. You prefer a larger screen and that's the biggest change from the original design. 

1080p screen: 720p is more than enough for a 6" but with a little bit more we can go full HD. 
64GB storage capacity: 32GB is quite small for a lot of awesome games. This one is a priority for us. 
Windows 10: You want all your Windows only games on your SMACH Z and we will work on supporting it too.
Battery Life: 5h are great, but extra batteries are your only salvation on a long trip. 
D-Pad: Classic controls has been one of the most demanded features. We are confident that with the Z-Pads everybody will be happy, and we plan to continue listening to your feedback. All the backers will be invited to participate in the development forum to give feedback and vote for SMACH Z features. For example, choosing the colors of certain models.
Lower Kickstarter goal: We've been looking for private investors to reach the goal and be able to go on.
  We still need to work on the final version of the console, for 6 months, updating the form factor, integrating the final hardware and implementing the final cooling system.
Prototype production: April-August 2016 
Final unit production: September 2016-February 2017
Shipment to backers: April 2017
Launch to market: December 2017-Q1 2018
      Any reward has to add 5€ shipping to United States and European Union or 10€ for the rest of the world. However, if we get to the Stretch Goal shipments will be free for everyone! If you have any doubt related to shipment to your country send us a message at support@smachz.com
  SMACH Z will fulfill European standards. We stand firmly behind our product. SMACH Z includes a 2 year limited warranty. For more information, please see:
http://smachz.com/warranty
If you need help, during or after the campaign has closed, you can reach us at support@smachz.com
  SMACH Z is being developed by a team of experienced video game industry developers, in association with a hardware manufacturer (ImasD), with more than 10 years of experience. ImasD is expert in designing and manufacturing mobile devices, such as tablets and consumer hardware, based in a patented technology: ClickArm. We’re excited to work together building a new console that will revolutionize the way people play Steam games.
The investors backing SMACH Z are Mola Factory and other undisclosed private investors. Mola is a tech venture holding focused on the Internet and technology companies to give them financial support and know-how. For more information: www.mola.com
You are also part of the SMACH Team. Join us in the project to bring PC games out of the house! The more we raise, the more we can do! Help us to make it REAL!

campaign.story:
Thank you to all of our Kickstarter backers for helping make the Tiny Tower a reality! To order a Tiny Tower please click the button below or above.
  You can also follow us on Instagram, Facebook or Twitter.
Thanks again!
    Laptops are extremely versatile but ergonomically they’re not ideal. The longer we spend on them, the more we hunch over them, causing pain in our neck, shoulders and back.
                                      The Tiny Tower is a beautifully crafted, portable and height adjustable laptop stand that can be used to create a really comfortable setup .. in the café, in the office, at home or wherever you are. 
      We know that everybody is different, so the Tiny Tower adjusts your screen quickly and easily to the right height for you to work comfortably. Simply change the height at the push of a button. Over 3" (8cm) of adjustment is available through 10 different height settings.
  The Tiny Tower folds down in under 10 seconds into a compact unit that's easy to carry with you. To create the ultimate mobile workstation, use it with the Tiny Tote — our high quality zipped nylon pouch that carries your Tiny Tower, keyboard and mouse.
  Own a Tiny Tower in a colour that matches your laptop .. or your style! As a crowdfunding only special, you can buy a Tiny Tower in Classic Silver, Space Grey, Rose Gold and Gold. We don't intend to make to multiple colours available when the Tiny Tower hits retail shelves .. so make sure you get one now.
  Aluminum is the main material used in the Tiny Tower because it's both lightweight and strong, making the Tiny Tower very stable. Your laptop will sit on a special non-slip polymer made by 3M to firmly secure your laptop. We've sweated the details like this to make sure you have a lasting product. The Tiny Tower feels great in your hands and even better on your desk.
    The Tiny Tower has a smaller footprint than your laptop, freeing up more desk space. 
  Your laptop will sit on a special non-slip polymer made by 3M to firmly secure your laptop. The Tiny Tower can be used with the fingers concealed inside the arms or extended for added security. It's your choice.
  The Tiny Tower will reliably support both Windows and Mac laptops 11" up to and including 15”. It will even support the Microsoft Surface and Surface Pro.
The Tiny Tower is truly versatile.
It can be used at a standing desk (please note that it's not designed to replace a standing desk or worksurface).
The Tiny Tower supports Microsoft Surface natively and other tablets including the iPad provided they come with a self supporting stand.
Each Tiny Tower comes with a quality slide on protective sleeve.
(From L to R) Used at a standing height table. With a Microsoft Surface. Tiny Tower with protective sleeve.
  The Tiny Tote is a custom designed carry pouch made to hold your Tiny Tower, wireless keyboard and mouse. There's also room for other items like your headphones and spare batteries. The Tiny Tote is constructed with a quality nylon outer shell and has a lined and padded inner divider to ensure that nothing gets damaged. The Tiny Tote is available separately.
  The Tiny Tower comes in a beautiful bead-blasted and anodised aluminum finish in silver and black. Plastic components are made from quality engineering grade composites that are strong yet light at the same time.
When we designed the Tiny Tower, we wanted to create something that would provide superior ergonomics and also look great in any workspace.
          A digital copy of our beautiful custom illustrated laptop usage artwork will be sent to every one who pledges.
        We ship to all EU countries.
For EU backers in selected countries, you will not need to pay extra customs, duties or taxes. Your pledge is final. No nasty surprises!
The selected countries are Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and United Kingdom.
  Over the past 18 months, we have constructed seven fully working prototypes. Each time we built a new one, we aimed to remove complexity whilst improving functionality and ease of use. We worked hard to ensure The Tiny Tower offers super simple height adjustment. It works just like the extendable handle on checked travel luggage. We also knew that to have it fold into a compact and lightweight unit is important, allowing you to take it with you and protect your posture whenever you work. 
Snapshots from our time spent with suppliers.
We've travelled to Asia several times and collaborated with multiple suppliers to finalise our manufacturing plans. We are ready to build the tooling required for large volume manufacturing. We are confident and excited. We believe we're further down the development path than most hardware projects that launch on Kickstarter.
      The Big Tiny Co is a Sydney-based hardware company led by Matt Cramsie (right) and Anhtai Anhtuan (left). We’re passionate about beautiful design, flexible working, and health and wellbeing. We believe that superior ergonomics and great design should go together.
Matt has over 15 years experience designing products for Australia’s leading furniture companies. His products have earned him an Australian Design Award and several design awards overseas. The Tiny Tower is his most personal product and he is very proud to launch it here on Kickstarter.
Anhtai has built a 12 year career in product management and technology. He has a Masters in Management and is responsible for operations, making sure that quality made Tiny Towers roll off the production line and get delivered safely to your doorstep.
Origin of the Tiny Tower
The original idea of the Tiny Tower came about when Matt suffered a serious disc herniation in his neck combined with numbness down his right arm in 2014. At the time, Matt was constantly hunching over his laptop, which added a significant load on his neck.
Many existing solutions to raise the height of your laptop don't offer the trifecta of functionality that is needed: height adjustment, portability and an attractive design you'd be proud to use. So being an award-winning industrial designer who is obsessive about ergonomics, Matt decided to create the Tiny Tower to fill that gap.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Tiny Tower has been in development for over 18 months. We built seven fully working prototypes to test the product's functionality and durability.

We are working to limit the risk of any delays in production and delivery by developing the product to a point where both we and our suppliers are confident we are ready to start production tooling.

We’ve built partnerships with 2 experienced manufacturers to mitigate as many risks as possible. We know there will be unexpected challenges along the way and we are committed to being transparent and informing you of any potential hurdles as we progress.

We are confident and excited. We believe we're further down the development path than most hardware projects that launch on Kickstarter.

EXPERIENCE
As mentioned, the design, engineering and manufacturing teams have many years of experience working on the design and manufacture of products with very similar materials and assembly techniques.

SHIPPING DATES
We are allowing extra time for tooling and manufacturing and are confident we will ship by the scheduled dates. We want to get your Tiny Tower to you as soon as possible! If things take longer than planned, we will always keep you informed.

CHALLENGES
Our biggest challenge is meeting our funding goal! If you like The Tiny Tower, please help us by sharing a link to the project on your Facebook profile, Twitter or any other social media platform you choose. Thanks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
